document.masterDocTitle: Taxonomic study of the genus Blastobasis Zeller, 1855 (Lepidoptera: Blastobasidae) from China, with descriptions of six new species

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Taxonomic study of the genus Blastobasis Zeller, 1855 (Lepidoptera: Blastobasidae) from China, with descriptions of six new species

bibRefCitation.author: Adamski, D. & Li, H. H.
bibRefCitation.refString: Adamski, D. & Li, H. H. (2010) Three new species of Blastobasinae moths from Beijing, China (Lepidoptera: Gelechioidea, Coleophoridae). SHILAP Revista de Lepidopterologia, 38 (151), 341 - 351.

paragraph.treatmentCitationGroup:
Blastobasis drymosa
Adamski et Li, 2010: 345
.
Type locality: China ( Beijing )
. Type deposited: NKU.

Diagnosis . Adult ( Fig. 6 ) forewing length 4.5–7.0 mm.
Blastobasis drymosa
is distinguished by the dorsal part of the valva with the costal process bearing a row of elongate spine-like setae, and the membrane above the proximal flange bearing a cluster of elongate spine-like setae in the male genitalia ( Fig. 16 ); and the intersegmental membrane posterior to the seventh segment with a subquadrate area of dense microtrichiae flanking ostium, and the seventh sternum deeply concave in broad V-shape on the posterior margin in the female genitalia ( Fig. 25 ). It is similar to
B. sprotundalis Park, 1984
and
B. parki
Sinev, 1986
in the genital structures, and the differences between them can be given in the diagnoses of the preceding two species.
Distribution . China ( Beijing , Hebei , Henan , Hubei , Shaanxi , Shanxi , Sichuan , Tianjin , Yunnan ).
